channel.title: Fed on Archive 03
channel.description: Recent content in Fed on Archive 03

item.title: Powell's Dovish Turn: The Fallout from the 2025 Jackson Hole Meeting
item.description: At the 2025 Jackson Hole meeting, Fed Chair Jerome Powell pivoted to a dovish stance, sparking market euphoria. As expectations for a rate cut grow, three distinct characters engage in a fierce debate, weighing the optimism against the underlying risks of an economic slowdown and inflation.

item.title: Is the Fed's Rate Cut Really Good News for the Stock Market?
item.description: Three characters clash over the impact of the U.S. Federal Reserve’s interest rate cut on the market. Kurumi predicts a bull market, cheering for a liquidity party, while Mikael strongly warns it’s a precursor to a recession. We analyze the two faces of rate cuts through historical data and explore the wise stance investors should take.
